surveyor.tests.test_utils module¶

class surveyor.tests.test_utils.GetQuestionsTestCase(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: django.test.testcases.TestCase

classmethod setUp()¶

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

test_chart_likert_labels_correct()¶

Questions with response_type = 1 (likert questions) should have labels: ‘Strongly Disagree’, ‘Disagree’, ‘Neutral’, ‘Agree’, ‘Strongly Agree’.

test_chart_traffic_labels_correct()¶

Questions with response_type = 2 (traffic light questions) should have labels: ‘Red’, ‘Yellow’, ‘Green’.

test_data_formatted_appropriately()¶

Each dictionary in the list data should contain keys: id, link, type, description, link_clicks, pie_chart_labels, pie_chart_data, word_cloud.

test_link_clicks_correct()¶

Tests whether the number of link clicks returned is the same as the number of link clicks recorded per question.

test_question_descriptions_correct()¶

Tests whether the descriptions to each of the questions returned are correct: we do not return any descriptions of questions that are not part of the task and do not neglect any descriptions that are part of the task.

test_word_cloud_url_correct()¶

If a question contains a text-based response, we should get a link to a generated word cloud image of the form ‘data:image/png;base64’ + string.

class surveyor.tests.test_views.TaskOverViewTestCase(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: django.test.testcases.TestCase

classmethod setUp()¶

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

test_response_code_200_if_valid()¶

Accessing /task/ should give status code of 200. Accessing /task/a where a is an invalid UUID should not give you a status code of 404, though we know this behaviour is already defined given the internal dependency on the django-core get_object_or_404 method which has already been extensively tested.
